channel.title: construction on Barefoot Rob
channel.description: Recent content in construction on Barefoot Rob

item.title: overlooking construction
item.description:
12:07 Thursday 27 June 2019 JST Today on my way back home from lunch, I saw a construction site which was overlookable from a pretty steep hill just beside it.
By standing on the guardrail, I could easily have fallen forward over their fence. Nice shot, though!

item.title: weird bridge near shinyuri
item.description: 20:22 Thursday 03 May 2018 JST This looks like a bridge from the sidewalk level over here to the roof level over there. Not enough room for an elevator; I am not sure what this might be for.

item.title: pics of Toshiba Muza bridge
item.description: 09:22 Tuesday 16 January 2018 JST These are from May and July 2017

item.title: noborito construction
item.description: 00:07 Friday 06 October 2017 JST I just discovered I uploaded these, but it seems I did not add them to my journal.

item.title: Noborito station is getting a new southbound line
item.description: 18:34 Sunday 27 August 2017 JST I have been taking (but not really posting) pictures of the new train line in Noborito station. I guess it’s part of the campaign Odakyu has been announcing that they will reduce the congestion on the line, and even decrease the time required to go to Shinjuku. Anyway, they did something which surprised me: put down the rails, locked them down, then took them back up before laying them down again.

item.title: Bridge (to be built) between Toshiba and Muza
Giant Post Hole Digger!
item.description: 16:17 Wednesday 29 July 2015 JST Oh my gosh wow!!! I like watching construction so I often take pictures of construction sites. Today I was having a gander at new building construction near 金沢八景駅 and I noticed a big digger thing suspended over a large vertical tube. Then I noticed the tube was slowly rotating! I started taking video with Periscope (so it’s online now, even before this message is written) and stepped over a fence, which gained the attention from an English speaking security guard!

item.title: changes around 金沢八景
item.description: ##16:14 Wednesday 25 March 2015 JST## I took a few pictures of some old buildings and an empty lot, all of which will soon apparently become a construction site. This is between 京急 and シーサイド lines respective 金沢八景stations, an area that’s been undeveloped for quite some years! I can remember coming here about 11 years ago with someone Frank’s NOVA classes. She taught me the phrase まじで？ And the same night we heard someone use it.
